channel.title: Lifehacker
channel.description: Tips and downloads for getting things done
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Top 10 Ways to Save More Money at Costco and Other Warehouse Clubs
item.description:
Millions of people regularly shop at Costco, BJ's, and Sam's Club because of the significant discounts not found anywhere else. You can keep

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: Share Reminders Lists with Other Users Over iCloud
item.description:
Reminders are a handy feature in iCloud, especially when you tag locations . You may already know you can share these reminder lists with other iCloud users, but in case you don't, here's how.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Take Some Time to Look Up from Your Phone This Weekend
item.description:
Despite our love for technology, we (and others) have talked ad nauseum about the social downsides of burying your face in a screen. But few arguments convey the idea as well as this five minute video.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: Faces.im Brings Facebook’s Chat Heads to Chrome
item.description:
If you'd like Facebook Messenger notifications when you aren't looking at Facebook, you can get chat head-style notifications with the faces.im Chrome extension.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: Keep Your Laptop Cool with an Egg Carton
item.description:
If you're in dire need of some way to cool down your laptop and don't want to spend the cash on a cooling pad, Instructables has a simple solution in the form of some overturned egg cartons.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: Set Meaningful Goals with These Five Principles
item.description:
Sometimes the only thing you need to get motivated is a clear goal with challenging aspects. Mind Tools explains how to set these types of goals with five basic principles.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: Gawker Kid With "Diyareeya" Just Set the New Bar for Letters from Summer Camp | Jezebel That Time Yo
item.description:
Gawker Kid With "Diyareeya" Just Set the New Bar for Letters from Summer Camp | Jezebel That Time You Accidentally Got Way Too High | Jalopnik Genius Buys $500 Car Instead Of Greyhound Bus Ticket | Kotaku It Took Seven Years To Tweet Every Word In The English Language | Kinja Popular Posts

item.dc:creator: Jessica Smith on io9, shared by Whitson Gordon to Lifehacker

item.title: The Novelty Effect Explains Why a New App Makes You More Productive
item.description:
Let's say you get a new app, and for the first couple of weeks, that app seriously boosts your productivity. You like using it. You have fun using it. You make all kinds of great things. But over time, you stop using it. Psychologists call this the novelty effect, and although it sounds like a negative, writer Clive Thompson explains why it's useful.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: The Five Questions Successful People Routinely Ask Themselves
item.description:
While everyone has a different definition of professional success, the one thing all successful people share in common is a drive to be better than the day before. Forward momentum is key, and you can keep yourself in check by asking the right questions.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Karyn Mullins

item.title: Learn Everything You Need to Know About Diodes with This Video
item.description:
Diodes are one of the most important parts of any electronics project, and if you don't understand how they work you'll destroy any electronics project you work on. Thankfully, Adafruit has a video that explains how they work.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Build a Raspberry Pi Powered Retro Game Console Inside a Game Boy
item.description:
We've seen plenty of ways to use a Raspberry Pi as a retro game center , but if you really want to do it right, XodusTech shows how to build that game console into a Game Boy.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Keep Fridays Productive by Completing Low Energy Tasks
item.description:
Everyone wants to check out early on Fridays, but weblog Asian Efficiency suggests completing your low energy tasks so your day is easy, but still productive.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: This Week's Most Popular Posts: May 30th to June 6th
item.description:
This week we paid for our Costco membership , downloaded some useful Windows programs , learned all about Apple's new releases , and learned why we should make our beds . Here's a look back.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: Make Sauce-Thickening Roux in Minutes in the Microwave
item.description:
Roux, a combination of flour and oil or butter, is often used as a base for many sauces , to thicken stews, make gravy, and add a nutty, toasted flavor to dishes like gumbo. If you're short on time or just want to skip the constant stirring, make roux in the microwave.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: Cover Your House in Pegboard, $1 Credit Card Knife, iTunes Gift Cards
item.description:
Pegboard is, in my opinion, one of the most underutilized organization solutions out there. Sure you can use it to hold tools, but there's nothing stopping you from turning it into a cable management solution , shelving , or even a kitchen organizer . This particular version is made of durable galvanized steel, and is only $25 per set today. [Galvanized Steel Pegboard Set, $25]

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister, Commerce Team

item.title: Cover a Wall with a Giant Whiteboard for Under $15
item.description:
Whiteboards or dry erase boards are awesome planning tools and creativity boosters, especially when they practically cover a whole wall. Instead of spending $300 for a giant whiteboard or messing with inconsistent paint, here's the easiest and cheapest solution.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: ​Master the Art of Small Talk with Strangers to Be Happier
item.description:
Silent train and bus journeys can be long and miserable, but one study found that a bit of small talk with strangers can make those trips more enjoyable.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: Should I Install the iOS 8 and OS X Yosemite Betas?
item.description:
Dear Lifehacker,
I'm not a developer or anything, but I'm really excited about the new improvements in iOS 8 and OS X Yosemite . Is it safe to install the betas for them? What's the experience going to be like if I do?

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: ​Get Ready for a Hospital Stay with This Checklist
item.description:
Getting ready for a hospital trip may not be something we like to think about, but it's good to be prepared. Over at Real Simple, they have a handy checklist that'll ensure you don't miss anything.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: Whistle Phone Finder Locates your Android with a Whistle
item.description:
Android: Hunting for a lost phone can be a nightmare, particularly if you're on your own and can't call it. Whistle Phone Finder is a free Android app that helps you to locate a misplaced handset by whistling.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: Power Up Your XBMC Installation with These Awesome Add-Ons
item.description:
One of the best parts about XBMC, the kickass customizable media center software , is its browser-like extensions. If you've ever wanted to incorporate watching TV, listening to podcasts, or playing video games to your XBMC box, this is how it works.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: Flickr is removing Facebook and Google sign-in.
item.description:
Flickr is removing Facebook and Google sign-in. From now on, you'll need a Yahoo account to log into Flickr. You can migrate your current account here.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: Put Paper over Automatic Toilet Sensors to Prevent Accidental Flushes
item.description:
Mankind, in its great hubris, created automatically flushing toilets as a way to ensure clean public bathrooms. The result, however, are wonky sensors that flush four or five times as you sit on them. Get your peaceful potty break back with a bit of paper over the sensor.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: SndLater Schedules Outgoing Gmail, Reminds You to Check In Later
item.description:
Chrome: Scheduling outgoing Gmail messages isn't exactly new . SndLater makes it dead simple to schedule an email for later, and also allows you to remind yourself to check in on a conversation after a set amount of time.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: Stop Trying to "Earn" Leisure and Put Relaxation on Your To-Do List
item.description:
Many of us feel like we have to justify doing nothing. Even if you're not a workaholic, you've probably felt guilty at some point for watching TV instead of getting things done. If so, chances are you've got your priorities a bit mixed up.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft
